revised_title: Explaining Local Species Diversity in Drosophilid Flies
tldr: The authors examine various explanations for local species diversity in Drosophilid flies, focusing on niche heterogeneity, spatial heterogeneity, and the fullness of the niche space. They conclude that Drosophila communities are dominated by intraspecific aggregation rather than resource partitioning and are not fully saturated. This study provides insights into the factors that maintain species diversity in insect populations.
